problem: Water and then oil (which don't mix) are poured into a U-shaped tube, open at both ends. They come to equilibrium as shown in the figure. What is the density of the oil? [Hint: Pressures at points a and b are equal. Why?]

variables.meaning: height of oil column above interface

correctFormulas.name: Hydrostatic pressure balance in connected columns
correctFormulas.formula: P₀ + ρ₍oil₎ g h₍oil₎ = P₀ + ρ₍w₎ g h₍water₎

steps.explanation: Points at equal depth in the connected fluid share the same pressure, so equate pressures at levels a and b.
Solve for oil density using the measured column heights.
